problem.p: A small block of mass m slides on a long horizontal table when it encounters a wedge of mass 2m and height h (see the diagram).
The wedge can also slide along the table. The mass slides up the wedge all the way to the top and then slides back down, never getting over the top. All surfaces are frictionless.
The speed of the block is:

choicegroup.choice: The same at t1 and t3

problem.p: My answer to part 1 is justified because:

choicegroup.choice: The horizontal component of the momentum of the block-wedge system and the mechanical energy of the block-wedge-Earth system are conserved.
The energy of the block-wedge-Earth system is conserved but the momentum of the block-wedge system is not.
The momentum of the block-wedge system is conserved but the energy is not
There is no friction between the wedge and the block.
